comment.indexationObject: Indexing an object, or the tree whose object is the root. Based on the PID, or list of PIDs inserted into the form, or read from a file
comment.indexationModel: Indexing of objects (and their trees) that have the selected model

removeFromThisCollection.title: Removal from collection
removeFromThisCollection.message: Do you really want to remove {{value1}} from the collection {{value2}}

removeCollection.title: Deleting a collection
removeCollection.message: Do you really want to permanently delete the collection

addItemsToCollection.title: Adding items to a collection
addItemsToCollection.message: For each PID entered, an item will be added to the collection. Part of adding each item to a collection is scheduling the indexing process, so collection membership may not be immediately apparent

addItemToCollection.titleCollection: Adding a collection to another collection
addItemToCollection.titleObject: Adding an object to a collection
addItemToCollection.messageCollection: This collection will be added to another collection. Part of adding to a collection involves scheduling the indexing process, so belonging to a collection may not be immediately apparent
addItemToCollection.messageObject: The object will be added to the collection. Part of adding to a collection involves scheduling the indexing process, so belonging to a collection may not be immediately apparent

removeRight.title: Removal of right
removeRight.message: You really want to remove the right

scheduleChangePolicyByPid.title: Visibility change
scheduleChangePolicyByPid.messageFixed: A Visibility Change process will be scheduled for the selected PID, which will set the POLICY flag of the object, possibly also its descendants.
scheduleChangePolicyByPid.messageNotFixed: For each inserted PID, a Change Visibility process will be scheduled, which will set the POLICY flag of the object, possibly also its descendants.

scheduleAddLicense.title: Adding a licensee
scheduleAddLicense.messageFixed: The Add License process will be scheduled for the selected PID
scheduleAddLicense.messageNotFixed: An Add License process will be scheduled for each PID inserted

scheduleRemoveLicense.title: License withdrawal
scheduleRemoveLicense.messageFixed: A License Removal process will be scheduled for the selected PID
scheduleRemoveLicense.messageNotFixed: A License Removal process will be scheduled for each PID entered

scheduleIndexationByPid.title: Object indexing
scheduleIndexationByPid.message: For each inserted PID, an Indexing process will be scheduled, which (re)indexes the object, possibly also its descendants (according to the type of indexing)
scheduleIndexationByPid.explanation: How the Indexer should behave if it encounters an object that cannot be indexed due to an incorrect binding structure. It can skip the object, log the error and continue. Or terminate the Process in Error state

scheduleProcessingIndexRebuildForObject.title: Rebuilding the Processing index for the object
scheduleProcessingIndexRebuildForObject.message1: The process Rebuild Processing index for object deletes the Description record of the selected object and all Relation records for links leading from the selected object from the Processing index. Subsequently, it creates a Description record and Relation records from the FOXML object in the Repository (Akubra)
scheduleProcessingIndexRebuildForObject.message2: The process needs to be started after hitting the RELS-EXT FOXML record directly in the Repository, outside of the Krameria tools. Typically this involves adding and/or removing a bond.
scheduleProcessingIndexRebuildForObject.message3: After the process is completed, the affected object (only it) needs to be re-indexed. And all the objects (in depth) that were assigned/removed under the object by manipulations with bindings in FOXML.
scheduleProcessingIndexRebuildForObject.message4: Attention! The process does not repair bindings to this object. In the event of a more extensive intervention in the Repository data, this process needs to be started for each object whose bindings have been changed in the Repository. Alternatively, run a rebuild of the entire Processing index.

deleteObjectTreeWithProcess.title: Deleting the object tree (smartly)
deleteObjectTreeWithProcess.message:
Are you sure you want to permanently delete the object including all its* content?
A process will be scheduled that will gradually delete the entire object tree from the repository and the search index.
The process will also synchronize the data of the relevant objects, which deletion will affect with regard to licenses and collections.
*Does not apply to the contents of collections. Deleting a collection does not include recursively deleting its items.

deleteObjectFromRepo.title: Object deletion (low-level)
deleteObjectFromRepo.message: Are you sure you want to permanently delete the object? The object will be deleted from the repository and the search index. However, references to this object from other objects will not be updated, nor will other referenced objects be deleted.

scheduleDeleteObjectsSmart.title: Deleting object trees
scheduleDeleteObjectsSmart.message1: A PID Tree Delete process will be scheduled for each inserted PID.
scheduleDeleteObjectsSmart.message2: The process gradually deletes all objects in the tree from PID<sup>*</sup>, both from the repository and the search index.
scheduleDeleteObjectsSmart.message3: Furthermore, the process synchronizes the data of the relevant processes that the deletion will affect with regard to licenses and collections.
scheduleDeleteObjectsSmart.explanation: <sup>*</sup>Does not apply to the contents of collections. Deleting a collection does not include recursive deletion of its items. Because collection items are not the collection's own children, the collection just points to them.

deleteObjectsLowLevel.title: Deleting objects from the repository (low-level)
deleteObjectsLowLevel.message1: One object will be deleted for each PID inserted.
deleteObjectsLowLevel.message2: The object will be deleted from the repository and the search index. However, references to this object from other objects will not be updated. Nor will other referenced objects be deleted. There will also be no synchronization with regard to licenses and collections.
deleteObjectsLowLevel.message3: This operation may cause inconsistencies in the Digital Library!

scheduleProcessingIndexRebuild.title: Building the Processing index
scheduleProcessingIndexRebuild.message1: The Build Processing index process deletes the existing Processing index and creates a new index from the data in the Repository (Akubra).
scheduleProcessingIndexRebuild.message2: Since all FOXML objects are traversed, this is a demanding operation that can take tens of hours (depending on the size of the repository and the available computing power). Therefore, it is recommended to back up the Processing index first.

backup.title: Processing index backup procedure:
backup.2: backup the Processing index data directory: typically $SOLR_HOME/server/solr/processing/data

recovery.title: Processing index recovery procedure:
recovery.2: replace the Processing index data directory with a backup

message.foxml:
Schedule a process that imports FOXML files from the selected import directory on the server.

The root directory for FOXML imports is typically $HOME/.kramerius/import.
message.ndk:
Schedule a process that converts NDK METS format files from the selected import directory on the server and imports the result.

The root directory for NDK METS imports is typically $HOME/.kramerius/ convert.
